meanings.definition: Displaying images in which the individual pixels are visible.
meanings.sent1: The computer screen showed a pixelated picture of a cat.
meanings.sent2: The TV broadcast became pixelated during the storm.
meanings.sent3: I tried to draw a pixelated heart, but it ended up looking like a square blob.
meanings.sent4: Her memories of the event were pixelated, like a mosaic of emotions.
meanings.sent5: The old video game had a charmingly pixelated aesthetic.

meanings.definition: Confused or disoriented, as if looking at a pixelated image.
meanings.sent1: After the dizzying ride, she felt pixelated and unsure of her surroundings.
meanings.sent2: The complex instructions left him feeling pixelated and lost.
meanings.sent3: Trying to follow the map in the city made him feel pixelated, like a digital tourist.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were pixelated, scattered like a jigsaw puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The fog made everything seem pixelated and surreal.

meanings.definition: To alter an image by making it appear pixelated.
meanings.sent1: He decided to pixelate the background of the photo to protect privacy.
meanings.sent2: The artist chose to pixelate the face of the subject for anonymity.
meanings.sent3: She pixelated the image to give it a retro video game vibe.
meanings.sent4: The security camera footage was pixelated to obscure identities.
meanings.sent5: The software allows you to easily pixelate sensitive information in photos.
